name: Old Kingdom Egypt: concept of zero and ten
details: The Egyptians developed a number system based on the number 10. The concept of 10 is a driving force in binary, and you have 0, 1, and 10 as the numbers.

name: Thales
details: Thales thought that all events can be explained in natural terms that can be understood by humans. This shift in thinking started mankinds ability to discover science and technology.

name: Pythagoras
details: The inventor of mathematics. He created a system for expressing equation (such as 2 + 2 = 4)

name: Euclid
details: Exact birth year and death year are unknown. Euclid used the foundation of Pythagoras' work to write a math text that was used for nearly 2,000 years.

name: Democritus
details: The champion of the Atomists. The Atomists proposed that all matter and even immaterial things are made up of tiny indivisible particles called 'atoms'.

name: Plato
details: Created the worlds first university called the Academy.

name: Hippocrates
details: Extended science to medicine. Proved that science can improve human life.

name: Aristotle
details: Creator of the scientific method, he laid the foundation for future discovery.

name: Algebra
details: An important part of mathematics which was invented by the Muslims.

name: Archimedes
details: The inventor of scientific notation, Archimedes also made significant contributions to mechanics, hydraulics, warfare, mathematics, and astronomy. Newton used his principles as a starting point for his own work.

name: Hero of Alexandria
details: A Roman Greek inventor, Hero created a kind of steam engine. Sadly, his work was ignored by the Roman Empire.

name: Ibn Sina (Avicenna)
details: Muslim scientist who wrote nearly 450 books on topics such as philosophy, logic, medicine, astronomy, theology, psychology, poetry, physics, metaphysics, astrology, pharmacology, exercise science, mathematics, chemistry, and earth sciences.

name: Ibn Rushd (Averroës)
details: Muslim thinker who presevered and provided commentary on Aristotles work. His work lead to European Scholasticism in the 13th century.

name: Mechanical Clock
details: Probably the pinnacle of European technology in the Middle Ages, the mechanical clock was a major advancement in time keeping.
